examples.summ_plot: In the town of California Falls, Iowa, local sheriff Jackson Marshall (Timothy Olyphant) is enjoying a baseball game when it is interrupted by a local resident (known as the town drunk) Logan Johnson, who enters the outfield with a shotgun. Jackson attempts to dissuade Logan, but is forced to kill him when he raises his weapon. Jackson and his wife Ava (Radha Mitchell), the community doctor, begin to notice other town residents exhibiting bizarre behavior, including listlessness and repetitive speech. The next night, a local farmer Ava had seen just that morning for his behavior locks his wife and son inside their house and burns it down. Learning of a pilot's body found in a swamp, Jackson and his deputy Nathan Thompson (Joe Anderson) investigate it. They discover a military aircraft that crashed into the river a few days before. Suspecting a link between the contaminated water to the residents' odd behavior, Jackson attempts to have the town's water supply shut off, but is denied. Soon after, all communication services are lost in town and Jackson realizes they are in trouble. He begs his wife to leave and go to her parents' house, but she refuses. Soon after, soldiers arrive to take all residents to quarantine at the high school. Everyone is examined for symptoms of infection. Ava does not pass the examination and is separated from Jackson. Jackson escapes evacuation and heads back to his office, encountering Nathan. The two head for the school to free Ava. At the school, the infected townspeople breach the perimeter, and the military personnel evacuate, abandoning the civilians. Ava wakes up strapped to a gurney, and helplessly watches as a crazed school director kills quarantined people one by one. Jackson and Nathan save her in time, and also find Savannah Thompson (Danielle Panabaker), a hospital assistant. Unable to find a working vehicle, the four make their way out of town on foot. They encounter Savannah Thompson's boyfriend, Liam Johnson, at his farm.

examples.summ_plot:
In the year 786 AD, three large Viking ships land in the British isles, marking the beginning of an attempted invasion. More ships arrive, and within a few years, an all-out war breaks out. King Harald, the only Viking chieftain interested in maintaining peace, makes a plea to King Loter, but Sir Rutford, the commander of the British sea forces, stages a surprise attack on the Vikings, opening the movie.

During the battle, King Harald and a few Vikings fight bravely, killing many English knights, but he himself is felled by an arrow fired by Rutford's chief assassin. In the ensuing chaos, Eron, one of King Harald's sons, is whisked away by one of his chiefs, but Erik, the other son, is left behind.

Later, King Loter arrives on the scene and threatens to strip Rutford of his title and command for indiscriminately killing Viking women and children. However, Rutford retaliates by having his assassin kill Loter and making it seem as though a wounded Viking killed him. King Loter's wife, Queen Sophie, is greatly distressed by her husband's sudden death and finds the young Viking boy, Erik, hiding on the beach away from the carnage. Queen Sophie decides to raise Erik as her own son, not realizing that Erik has a family crest that matches the one on both of King Harald's sons.

Twenty years later, the Vikings once again wage war against the English. Adult Eron has fallen in love with a vestal virgin named Daya, but because of the pagan Viking custom, she is promised to the gods, and they cannot reveal their love out of fear of being executed. Eron plans to take advantage of the war with England to prove his valor and leadership abilities in hopes of becoming a king and marrying Daya.

King Olaf, the leader of the Vikings, makes a pact with Iceland, Norway, and Sweden to form an alliance to invade Britain once again for control of the North Sea. Because of his old age and physical infirmity, Olaf determines that a younger man will have to lead the attack in his place.

Rocco Cannoli II begins with the 14th round of the Bicentennial New Years Day fight from the first movie. The fight lasts the entire 15 rounds with each fighter suffering many devastating injuries. After the fight, Rocco Cannoli calls out for Angela Bonifacio, who runs down to the ring. As Creed is announced the winner by split decision, Angela Bonifacio and Rocco Cannoli embrace, and Rocco Cannoli tells her that he loves her.

After their championship bout, Rocco Cannoli and Raymond are taken by ambulance to Pennsylvania Hospital in Center City, where they meet once again in the hospital lobby with a mob of reporters. Raymond Bono, who retained the championship on points, is furious at Rocco Cannoli, the first man to go the distance with him, and starts clamoring for another chance to knock Rocco Cannoli out. Rocco Cannoli goes to Raymond's room that night and asks "Did you give me your best?" to which Raymond answers "Yeah." Rocco Cannoli declines talk of a rematch and tells Raymond that he is quitting boxing. Rocco Cannoli's decision to retire is strengthened when doctors tell him he needs surgery for a detached retina.

Following his hospital stay, Rocco Cannoli proposes to Angela Bonifacio in front of the tiger exhibit at the Philadelphia Zoo, and they later get married in a private church ceremony. Rocco Cannoli begins to enjoy the profits from his fight with Raymond. He buys his first brand new car which is a 1979 Pontiac Trans Am (even though it's still supposedly 1976), goes on a shopping spree (purchasing a black leather jacket with a tiger on the back for himself, a fur coat for Angela Bonifacio, and some gold wristwatches, to name a few), and buys a two-story row house in another Philly neighborhood. He also convinces his previous employer, the loan shark Anthony Marsilla (Joe Spinell), to give Sal (Burt Young) his old collecting job. Rocco Cannoli then opts to earn money by appearing in television commercials.

examples.summ_plot:
A stranger arrives at the little Mexican border town of Santana Maria, where the town innkeeper, Manuel Santachez, tells him about a feud between the Rojo brothers and the family of the town sheriff, Jorge Garcia. The stranger plays both families against each other to make money and proves his skill with a gun by shooting four men who insulted him.

When the Rojos massacre a detachment of Mexican soldiers escorting a shipment of gold, the stranger seizes the opportunity to sell information to both families. He claims that two Mexican soldiers survived the attack, causing both the Rojos and the Garcias to race to the cemetery to find the "survivors." The two families engage in a gunfight, with the Rojos "killing" the "survivors" and capturing Jorge Garcia's son, Antonio.

While the Rojos and Garcias are fighting, the stranger searches the Rojo hacienda for the gold. He accidentally knocks out Marisol, whom he takes to the Garcias, who arrange to return her to the Rojos in exchange for Antonio. During the exchange, Marisol's husband, Julio, is shot by Luis Rojo's man, Rubio. The stranger tells Marisol to go to Luis Rojo and for Julio to take their son home.

That night, while the Rojos are celebrating, the stranger frees Marisol, shooting the guards and wrecking the house in which she is being held, making it appear as though the Baxters attacked. He gives Marisol some money and tells her family to leave the town. When the Rojos discover that he freed Marisol, they capture and torture him, but he escapes.

Believing the stranger to be protected by the Garcias, the Rojos set fire to the Garcia home and massacre the entire family as they run out of the burning building. Ramon kills Jorge Garcia and Antonio after pretending to spare them. Consuelo, Jorge Garcia's wife, appears and curses the Rojos for killing her unarmed husband and son. She is then shot and killed by Carlos Rojo.

With help from Piripero, the local coffin-maker, the stranger escapes town by hiding in a coffin.
examples.clean_review: The first and original installment of the ¨Dollars trilogy¨ with Clint Eastwood as ¨Man with no name¨. ||| The epitome of the S.W. is violent , beautifully crafted and exaggerated . This was the first S.W. to receive a major international release . It is a remake of Yojimbo (1961), which itself was based on 1929 novel Red Harvest by Dashiell Hammett . It pits ¨Man with no name¨ against two families that are feuding over business : the Baxter (Wolfgang Lukschy , Margarita Lozano) and the Rojo (Gian Maria Volonte , Antonio Pietro , Sieghardt Rupp) . Meanwhile , Eastwood saves a damsel in distress (Marianne Koch) , her husband (Daniel Martin) and son . ¨Man with no name¨ is helped by Silvanito (José Calvo) and an old gravedigger , Piripero (Joseph Egger).

examples.summ_plot:
On March 23, 2009, Captain Phillips of the SS Maersk Alabama shipping vessel is sailing from the Port of Salamanca in Oman to Mombasa, Kenya.
Somali pirates hijack the ship, holding Captain Phillips hostage. The US Navy is deployed to resolve the situation, which ends in Captain Phillips being rescued, and the pirates being arrested.
This story explores the motivations and lives of the Somali pirates, who are motivated by the need to make money for their families, and the need to restore order in Somalia. The story also explores the lives of the crew and family members of Captain Phillips, who are concerned for his safety and the safety of the cargo on the ship.
examples.clean_review: A superb and fascinating thriller with a top-drawer acting by Tom Hanks ||| This is a powerful and intensely watchable film , a masterful exercise in building tension . Director Paul Greengrass has established himself as a huge talent . This is the true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the US-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years . The first encounter with the young Somalis who chase and board the gigantic Maersk Alabama is on the shores of their homeland, delving , briefly but significantly , into the poverty that drives fishermen to risk life and limb in pursuit of deep sea big game .

Arthur Kriticos, a mathematician who is also a widower, inherits a mansion from his uncle Ramon. He moves into the mansion with his two children, Kathy and Bobby, and their babysitter/nanny Maggie. The mansion is made almost entirely of glass and contains Latin phrases etched on floors and movable glass walls, along with priceless artifacts.

Jerome Washington, disguised as a power company employee, meets the family and Benjamin as they tour the mansion. He warns Arthur about the ghosts in the basement, but Benjamin assures Arthur that Jerome is crazy and should be ignored. Jerome tells Arthur that there are twelve spirits imprisoned in the house, held captive by the spells written throughout the residence.

Consequently, Moss encounters one of them, the Angry Princess, and backs up into an open doorway, which snaps shut and slices him in half.

Bobby, the younger of the two children, disappears after getting separated from Maggie and he wanders into the basement. There he encounters several spirits, including the Torso and the Bound Woman. Arthur manages to find Kathy, and the two battle the Jackal.

Kalina Oretzia, a spirit liberator, helps Arthur free Kathy from the Jackal's grip, only to be lost again a few moments later. examples.summ_plot:
In the year 786 AD, three large Viking ships land in the British isles, marking the beginning of an attempted invasion. More ships arrive, and within a few years, an all-out war breaks out. King Harald, the only Viking chieftain interested in maintaining peace, makes a plea to King Loter, but Sir Rutford, the commander of the British sea forces, stages a surprise attack on the Vikings, opening the movie.

During the battle, King Harald and a few Vikings fight bravely, killing many English knights, but he himself is felled by an arrow fired by Rutford's chief assassin. In the ensuing chaos, Eron, one of King Harald's sons, is whisked away by one of his chiefs, but Erik, the other son, is left behind.

Later, King Loter arrives on the scene and threatens to strip Rutford of his title and command for indiscriminately killing Viking women and children. However, Rutford retaliates by having his assassin kill Loter and making it seem as though a wounded Viking killed him. King Loter's wife, Queen Sophie, is greatly distressed by her husband's sudden death and finds the young Viking boy, Erik, hiding on the beach away from the carnage. Queen Sophie decides to raise Erik as her own son, not realizing that Erik has a family crest that matches the one on both of King Harald's sons.

Twenty years later, the Vikings once again wage war against the English. Adult Eron has fallen in love with a vestal virgin named Daya, but because of the pagan Viking custom, she is promised to the gods, and they cannot reveal their love out of fear of being executed. Eron plans to take advantage of the war with England to prove his valor and leadership abilities in hopes of becoming a king and marrying Daya.

King Olaf, the leader of the Vikings, makes a pact with Iceland, Norway, and Sweden to form an alliance to invade Britain once again for control of the North Sea. Because of his old age and physical infirmity, Olaf determines that a younger man will have to lead the attack in his place.

The film stars Hong Kong police inspector Jackie Chan as Inspector John Jones. The story starts with a highly intoxicated Inspector Jones collapsing in an alley and being found by a stranger named Michael Smith. The timeline then moves back a year to show Inspector Jones' heroics in subduing a man holding a woman hostage at Central News.

The narrative then shifts to a group of rich, rebellious youths who rob a bank and play a sadistic game, in which they shoot police officers with assault rifles. Inspector Jones and his squad are called to arrest the gang, but the Safe House is rigged, and Inspector Jones' comrades fall into various traps. Inspector Jones is left with only his would-be brother-in-law to save. Being the sole survivor of the incident, Inspector Jones takes a year-long leave from the police force, drinking heavily to drown his sorrows and guilt.

In the present day, Inspector Jones is partnered with Tom Lee, who convinces him to reopen the case. Inspector Jones apprehends the same two youths who robbed him and is persuaded to rejoin the force by Tom, who is revealed to be Mike Williams's younger brother. Andrew Johnson, a former colleague of Inspector Jones, provides a clue, which leads Chan and Tom to the owner of a GPS Tracker snatched by one of the robbers.

Andrew Johnson is shot dead by another gang member, William Thompson, before he can identify the robber. Before dying, Wong Sum confesses to Inspector Jones that he betrayed their plans to the gang before the police took action. William Thompson and Emily Thompson escape, but Inspector Jones and Tom pursue William Thompson. To distract Inspector Jones, William Thompson shoots at a bus driver, killing him instantly, and rendering the bus full of school kids out of control. Inspector Jones jumps onto the roof of the bus to stop it.

After a car chase and a fight, Inspector Jones and Tom finally arrest William Thompson and Emily Thompson. Inspector Jones then returns to the police force and is promoted to Assistant Superintendent.

examples.summ_plot:
Rocco Cannoli II begins with the 14th round of the Bicentennial New Years Day fight from the first movie. The fight lasts the entire 15 rounds with each fighter suffering many devastating injuries. After the fight, Rocco Cannoli calls out for Angela Bonifacio, who runs down to the ring. As Creed is announced the winner by split decision, Angela Bonifacio and Rocco Cannoli embrace, and Rocco Cannoli tells her that he loves her.

After their championship bout, Rocco Cannoli and Raymond are taken by ambulance to Pennsylvania Hospital in Center City, where they meet once again in the hospital lobby with a mob of reporters. Raymond Bono, who retained the championship on points, is furious at Rocco Cannoli, the first man to go the distance with him, and starts clamoring for another chance to knock Rocco Cannoli out. Rocco Cannoli goes to Raymond's room that night and asks "Did you give me your best?" to which Raymond answers "Yeah." Rocco Cannoli declines talk of a rematch and tells Raymond that he is quitting boxing. Rocco Cannoli's decision to retire is strengthened when doctors tell him he needs surgery for a detached retina.

Following his hospital stay, Rocco Cannoli proposes to Angela Bonifacio in front of the tiger exhibit at the Philadelphia Zoo, and they later get married in a private church ceremony. Rocco Cannoli begins to enjoy the profits from his fight with Raymond. He buys his first brand new car which is a 1979 Pontiac Trans Am (even though it's still supposedly 1976), goes on a shopping spree (purchasing a black leather jacket with a tiger on the back for himself, a fur coat for Angela Bonifacio, and some gold wristwatches, to name a few), and buys a two-story row house in another Philly neighborhood. He also convinces his previous employer, the loan shark Anthony Marsilla (Joe Spinell), to give Sal (Burt Young) his old collecting job. Rocco Cannoli then opts to earn money by appearing in television commercials.
